clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Palonosetron on the QTc Interval During Perioperative Period
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Palonosetron on the QTc Interval During Perioperative Period

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of palonosetron on corrected QT interval duration during and after general anesthesia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 90 minutes after induction of general anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: at 2, 10, 15, 30, 60, 90 minutes after induction of general anesthesia, up to 1 minute after tracheal intubation

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients whose corrected QT interval (QTc interval) is more than 450 ms for male or 470 ms for female
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 hours after induction of general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.measure: corrected QT interval (QTc interval) at Postanesthetic care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 hour after arrival on postanesthetic care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting
proportion of patients who have more than 500 ms of corrected QT interval (QTc interval)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 hours after induction of general anesthesia

arm_group.description: Intravenous administration of palonosetron 0.075 mg before the induction of general anesthesia
Intravenous administration of normal saline before the induction of general anesthesia

intervention.description: 0.075 mg IV as bolus before induction of general anesthesia
2 ml normal saline as bolus before induction of general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective abdominal surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiac valvular disease
- Clinically significant arrhythmias including atrial fibrillation
- Anti-emetics within 24 hours before surgery
- Steroids within 1 week before surgery
- Cancer chemotherapy or radiotherapy within 4 weeks before surgery
- Diabetes mellitus
- Pregnancy
- Patients receives a QT-prolonging drug
